post.content: We just edited this post to add the ‚ÄúNew timeline settings" paragraph, which we forgot initially.In 4.5, administrators will be able to disable some (or all) live feeds, with a different setting for visitors and authenticated users. We added new attributes to the server configuration so clients can hide those live feeds buttons when they are disabled.

Are you a developer who likes to build on, or integrated with, Mastodon? We've got a great blog post for you, today - here's what is coming in Mastodon 4.5. The release candidate was tagged earlier today, with the final version really soon now ü§ûüèª(quote post authoring, AsyncRefresh API, and more)https://blog.joinmastodon.org/2025/10/mastodon-4-5-for-devs/

post.content: i think the experience of creating a tool, and then letting it 'possess' you into using it, is a weirdly useful way of thinking about stuff, despite how stupid it sounds

people are naturally good, in some way or other, at 'inhabiting a tool'. when you pick up the screwdriver or the camera or whatever, it becomes you. this is the origin of the "when all you have is a hammer, everything's a nail", i think. you have taken on the role of the hammer, or the screwdriver, or the camera, so you act in their manner. it's also why people get enamored with a pattern or programming language concept. they are possessed by its essence and are animating its will

@davidnjoku In the US, they've so normalized the idea of employees buying health insurance through their employers, that they ignore the problems this creates.Not all employers offer any, especially to P/T, new or gig workers.Since the employer controls the insurance, as the insurance company's main customer, they can get reports on usage. While data is anonymized, it can still be cross compared to payroll. Somebody had a major procedure, which employees were out that day? Find a reason to fire the sick. Privacy, my foot.The employer controls the insurance offerings. They can decide what gets covered. Viagra-yes, birth control-no (Elon.)If an employee gets sick and is then fired for excessive absence, they lose their health insurance. The fired employee can continue pay their health care premiums through their former  employer (COBRA), but the price can go up.If the employee is ill, they can't get another job, so they are also ineligible for unemployment benefits. They get to pay for their, say $500 a month, health coverage out of their $0 a month income. This is one of the ways we bankrupt sick people.Canada is better. Politicians in the US whine that in Canada people may have to wait to see a doctor.I wonder if they know it can take months to get an appointment here too?

post.content: My 7 year old daughter doing her homework (thinking): 9 √ó 4. What is 9 √ó 4?Me, the very helpful parent: Ah, there's an easy way to work that out. Remember that 9 is 3 squared and 4 is 2 squared. So all you have to do is multiply 3 by 2 and get the square of the product. Erm, I'm not helping, am I?Daughter: No, dad.Me: I'll go make dinner...

comments_and_replies.content: @davidnjoku 9's are the funnest numbers. Every number divisible by 9, adds up to 9.9+0? 9.9 +9? 18.1+8? 9.18 +9? 27.2+7? 9.Also, what's 10*4? well 10's are easy right?you do 10, add 10 is 20, then 30, then 40.How do you get to 9 from 10?You minus 1.OK so what happens when you do that 4 times?You've got 10 + 10 +10 +10 = 40, we know that.Minus 4, for each of the 10's you just had, 36.And what did we learn earlier? 6 +3 is? 9.That's how you know you've got the right answer.

post.content: Just finished the audiobook of The Trees by Percival Everett. It's really good - witty, pacy, and unflinchingly brutal. It's set in Trump's America, and is about race.Call me naive, but while I knew that systemic racism exists, and I knew that white rap fans sometimes say nigga, and I knew that cops get triggerhappy around Black men, I kinda thought that the in-your-face, 1960s-style racism was mostly a thing of the past. This book taught me that it isn't.#BlackMastodon #books

media_attachments.description: Cover image of The Trees by Percival Everett.  It's a colourful cover, with yellow, red, black and green concentric circles. There's also an image of a pair of fruits hanging from a tree.  Here's a free spoiler for you; in the book some men lose their balls.  That's what the image is meant to evoke.

post.content: I don't usually turn to Jimmy Carr for wisdom, but there's something he said that struck a chord with me:Depression comes from focussing on the past. Anxiety comes from focussing on the future.  Sometimes, you should try to focus on right now, where you have no problems. Let your head be where your feet are.

media_attachments.description:
Does Sweden Have Jurisdiction to Hear My Case?
In principle, if a crime is committed within Sweden, Swedish criminal
law is applicable. In addition to this general rule, other crimes may be
subject to Swedish criminal law regardless of where the crime took
place or the nationality, residency or current location of the perpetrator
and victim. This is known as universal jurisdiction. For example, the
ordinary criminal code applies to crimes committed outside Sweden
if a crime would be punishable by a minimum sentence of four years
under Swedish law, meaning it is sufficiently severe. Crimes that
qualify include: murder, kidnapping, gross rape etc.

Additionally, Sweden has universal jurisdiction in cases of serious
international crimes such as genocide, war crimes, and crimes against
humanity. Acts committed in July 2014 or after are prosecuted under
Sweden‚Äôs Act on Criminal Responsibility for Genocide, Crimes against
Humanity and War Crimes, which is modeled after the Rome Statute
of the International Criminal Court. Crimes committed before July
2014 can be prosecuted as ‚Äúcrimes against international law‚Äù under
the Swedish Penal Code. Murder, sexual and gender-based violence,
torture, and kidnapping can qualify as such a crime if they took place
in the context of an armed conflict or as part of a larger pattern of
violations.

Is There Anyone Sweden Will Not Try?
Sweden will not prosecute a government official who has immunity
under international law. This includes heads of state and government,
diplomats, and foreign ministers. However, this immunity ends when
a person leaves office, at which point a claim can be filed.
